article.headline: Coll. of Charleston 77, Winthrop 76
article.story: ROCK HILL, S.C. -- Antwaine Wiggins' short jumper in the lane with 24 seconds left lifted the College of Charleston to a 77-76 win over Winthrop on Monday night. Winthrop's Mantoris Robinson's 3-pointer from the left baseline with two seconds left was off the mark, giving the Cougars (10-1) their ninth straight win and best start since the 2001-02 season. Winthrop (1-9) led 44-41 at halftime and was up 69-66 with 9:12 left. After four lead changes, the Eagles had a 76-75 advantage with 2:12 remaining. Neither team scored until Wiggins' game-winner. The Eagles shot a season-best 55 percent (33-for-60), while the Cougars made 24 of 49 (40 percent). Charleston made 17 of 32 free throws compared to 6 of 10 for Winthrop. Andrew Goudelock led Charleston with 21 points, while Wiggins added 16. Charles Corbin paced the Eagles with a career-high 22 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
